column1: Small businesses are the backbone of our communities. I've heard from local businesses about their struggles during COVID and will keep fighting for federal relief. One way we can all support our small businesses is to shop local this holiday season.  #SmallBusinessSaturday https://t.co/18i4Dl6Mld

We need to double down on our efforts to combat the addiction crisis during COVID. Proud to lead this bipartisan bill with @RepDavidTrone @RepRiggleman & @RepArmstrongND and to see it pass unanimously in the House. https://t.co/XGh9pb8c8r

As COVID cases continue to rise across the country the PREPARE LTC Act and the PROTECT LTC Act are two critical steps we can take to improve oversight and take care of residents and workers. Thank you @RepJimmyPanetta for joining. https://t.co/sJARTAqp5L

The use of telehealth during the COVID crisis has demonstrated the critical role technology can play in improving health equity. I introduced bipartisan legislation with @RepMcKinley and 12 of our colleagues to increase access to telehealth services: https://t.co/WF5UPDQHei
Morris County will launch at-home and mobile COVID testing in the next week with federal funds from the CARES Act. I'll post information as more details become available. https://t.co/1ZkQUwUnjz

I appreciate that Dr. Hou and her staff are making important efforts to protect residents and caregivers as we face a COVID resurgence in New Jersey. I will continue to monitor and support this critical mission however I can.
Reminder that if you need a COVID test they are available at the following locations: https://t.co/GBFtb3Owws
If you need a COVID test Essex County will offer free tests at the following dates and times the week of Nov. 2: https://t.co/C34LCvyBmM

I have introduced a series of bills to address the problems at the heart of our coronavirus response including legislation with @BillPascrell to increase pandemic preparedness and a bill to speed up COVID testing results.

I am deeply concerned about reports of a COVID case at the Paramus Veterans Memorial Home especially after the tragic outbreak earlier this year. Concerns about nursing home preparedness competency and transparency are real.
If you need a COVID test in Essex County there are lots of opportunities next week: https://t.co/UzfwW5nqT6

I’m holding a webinar with @NewJerseyEDA on Friday to help small businesses with applications to the COVID relief grant program funded by the CARES Act. Registration and timing info here: https://t.co/wBKfW0bjY5
We received news that our child care provider received a positive COVID-19 test. Luckily everyone in our family has tested negative however we will be quarantining according to CDC guidelines.
Reminder free COVID testing is available. Here's October info for Passaic and Essex Counties: https://t.co/vCWPm1Ng3T

Appreciated the opportunity to visit the Islamic Center of Morris County to speak about COVID relief my support for the NO BAN Act and the casework services that my team can provide. https://t.co/vi9rEng3nQ

Yesterday was the 23rd emergency food distribution Essex County has sponsonsored during the COVID crisis. Thanks to @Joe_D_EssexExec & the county commissioners for bringing this back to Montclair. https://t.co/PtrTKgk9ys

Great to see everyone yesterday at our 2nd Annual First Responders Meet & Greet. We had the opportunity to thank our EMS Leaders Police Chiefs Fire Chiefs County Sheriffs & Prosecutors for their work during COVID present on federal grant opportunities and answer questions. https://t.co/GJfWegIcJL
Join my next telephone townhall on October 8th @ 5PM. We'll discuss COVID relief & feature a panel on managing COVID concerns work schedules and remote school. Details here: https://t.co/CTgcbP6HI4
Good overview by @wired on my bill w/ @RepDelBene and @RepTerriSewell to incentivize labs to speed up COVID test results. https://t.co/BLW82lL6We
Grateful to join @calvaryconnex's uplifting back-to-school outdoor service. I am so inspired by the way communities like Calvary Baptist have cared for each other during COVID.
Proud to help lead this effort to secure COVID relief for NJ families https://t.co/zKSQpU2Xbz

All four counties in #NJ11 residents municipalities medical providers nonprofits small businesses and educational organizations in the district have received over $4 billion in federal coronavirus relief since March.
Essex County Residents: Make an appt for free COVID testing Tuesday in Verona.   ➡️ https://t.co/ukn9WhI6uT https://t.co/nrtNZDoHvd
Unique Performance Arts Center in West Orange has been around for over 20 years. At the beginning of March the studio opened its new space only to close shortly after because of COVID-19.

Coming up on September 26th: @Zufall_Health is hosting an event in West Orange with free COVID testing HIV testing blood pressure screenings masks and food. Walk-ins welcome but you can pre-register by calling 973-325-2266 (ext. 381). More details here: https://t.co/omkALmO3AN
.@ChathamTownship Residents: There will be free COVID and antibody testing tomorrow at the Municipal Building from 11:00am - 6:00pm. Register here: https://t.co/hD9MqOFpuQ https://t.co/KWoeXiNKtO

We're so grateful to the METC for the ways that you have found to support the community during the pandemic. Developing online curricula for our schools the “share your story” project & holding concerts. All while dealing with the impact of COVID on your operations. Thank you!

The isolation & social distancing due to COVID have been hard on all of us. So moments like this afternoon’s concert are so needed. Thanks to the Museum of Early Trades and Crafts and the Madison Downtown Development Commission for making it happen. It is really a public service. https://t.co/kONEIF67iB

While these organizations were able to benefit from programs like the PPP EIDL and other grants early on during COVID more needs to be done.  That's why I'm sponsoring the Save our Stages Act the P4 Act and the RESTART Act and will work to see them signed into law.

The arts help contribute $1.2 billion to NJ’s economy annually. Supporting the arts during the pandemic is vital to both our arts community and our local economies. I'm grateful to the arts organizations in #NJ11 that joined my latest COVID response roundtable. https://t.co/gDfneTIADu

I joined @SRuhle this morning to talk about the president’s comments on our service members and veterans the struggle of parents with kids heading back to school this week and the need for another COVID relief package: https://t.co/7ikDGGwcER

Did you know that #NJ11 is home to 17 clinical trials for COVID-19 related therapeutics and vaccinations? Looking forward to the conversation today with the US Chamber of Commerce and our Morris County Chamber of Commerce!  Register here ⬇️ https://t.co/8o4XuvUiXR https://t.co/MioDHZsMWU

Eso Artisanal Pasta in Morristown participated in one of my small business roundtables last month and their story really resonated with me. The co-founders pivoted from job losses due to COVID to launching their dream taking the risk to reinvent themselves during this crisis. https://t.co/wJ4PBSNkgP

This bipartisan legislation is a historic investment in our open spaces will help us jumpstart our economic recovery from the COVID-19 crisis and will protect New Jersey’s natural resources and public lands for generations to come.

Pooled testing of COVID-19 samples can help labs meet nation-wide testing goals. It is especially valuable for areas of the country where the positivity rate is low.  I joined today with @RepMaxRose and @teammoulton to urge labs to employ pooled testing. Read more here ⬇️ https://t.co/onoTs2DuM7

Constituent Services Spotlight 🔦  Our small businesses have faced unprecedented challenges during COVID. When Villa Restaurant Group came to our office their feedback on PPP and EIDL helped me advocate for provisions of the PPP Flexibility Act and get it signed into law. https://t.co/xwt86tsMvz
Essex Residents: COVID-19 testing is available in Livingston this Thursday from 4-6pm. Visit https://t.co/K9sGluYbLq to learn more. https://t.co/Voq4dbntxk

Mike and Breanna own Gelati by Mike - Caldwell. I was blown away with how they’ve stepped up to support the community during COVID. They have donated more than 60000 bags of groceries to local food banks and their work inspired others to join their efforts. 🍨 https://t.co/HBre3GKy7i
Next stop the Verona Diner -- really impressed to see how they’ve repurposed their parking lot in the back for outdoor socially distant seating. ☕🧇 https://t.co/zKn8jmnKk8

Reminder: Our 5th virtual #MondayWithMikie on COVID-19 is coming up tomorrow at 5:00pm.  🖥️ Register Here: https://t.co/SNkzU5H8HC  📞 Or dial in by phone: 415-527-5035 🤳 Access Code: 199 789 4803  📥 Submit Questions Here: https://t.co/6fNTMWHBpg https://t.co/EbNTBJuJsI
Thank you to Mayor Conley Rev. Dunn from First Baptist Church of Madison and the @MadisonAreaYMCA for bringing this COVID-19 testing site to Madison this week. https://t.co/U71vDjtU03

If you missed this week’s #MondayWithMikie on Resources for Veterans During COVID-19 you can watch the video below. Thank you to our fantastic panel for joining me and more importantly for your dedication to our veteran community.  https://t.co/FrY7Eq1hKR

The educational opportunities they provide to students change lives. I will continue to fight for federal coronavirus funding for education and for the additional direct state and local government funding that can support these institutions in our bipartisan #SMARTFund.

I convened a roundtable this week to hear from the presidents of colleges and universities located in #NJ11 with a focus on the impact of COVID on their operations and on their students. https://t.co/sSC3BdcuQd
Essex County Residents: Upcoming COVID-19 testing locations in Cedar Grove and Livingston this week ⬇️ https://t.co/cRJanewhgX

Many NJ residents lost power for days after Tropical Storm Isaias while already dealing with the economic impact of COVID. I joined members of the delegation in urging JCP&L to work with its customers and offer the same reimbursements available to other residents after the storm. https://t.co/CKWhZkCeGF

Our 5th virtual #MondayWithMikie on COVID-19 is coming up on August 31st at 5:00pm.  🖥️ Register Here: https://t.co/SNkzU5H8HC  📞 Or dial in by phone: 415-527-5035 🤳 Access Code: 199 789 4803  📥 Submit Questions Here: https://t.co/6fNTMWHBpg https://t.co/vnIFq2FPMM

Constituent Services Spotlight 🔦  When Robert had trouble getting unemployment benefits during COVID-19 because of his military status our office worked closely with the state DOL to resolve his issue quickly. https://t.co/Coisa3CPsm

The fight against coronavirus requires partnership across all levels of government. Today the Governor announced that Morris County will receive $7.1 million and Sussex County will receive $1.8 million from the state's allocation of CARES Act funding. https://t.co/zFFjDiiy1h

Our community health centers like Zufall in #NJ11 help care for the most vulnerable members of our community. During COVID they have gone above and beyond like the mobile testing site I visited in Morristown in June. Thank you @Zufall_Health! #NationalHealthCenterWeek https://t.co/0CeHEbNAzi

Thanks to Hadassah Northern NJ for a great conversation on COVID-19 response the USPS managing a work/life balance during COVID & the importance of the US-Israel relationship. I am continually impressed with your mission of supporting Jewish values through volunteerism in NJ. https://t.co/YjQhgwjkKc

THREAD: With 5 million cases of COVID and 163K Americans dead Executive Orders that gut Social Security and Medicare and shift the UI cost to states don't cut it. Ignoring schools child care and food assistance isn’t leadership. Congress must pass a package to address:

Our next #MondayWithMikie on COVID-19 will be on August 10th at 12:00pm.   🖥️ Register Here: https://t.co/6URBIGuOZd  📞 Or dial in by phone: 415-527-5035 🤳 Access Code: 199 169 9734  📥 Submit Questions Here: https://t.co/puDEyWhSkg https://t.co/IKL2o9gw2O
Details on the Essex County #COVID19 satellite testing location in Bloomfield on Tuesday August 4th 👇 https://t.co/4HgVG2DbC6

There’s a time and a place for investing in defense. When Senate Republicans are balking at funding for SNAP benefits unemployment insurance and aid for state and local governments putting $7 billion for weapons programs in a coronavirus response package is offensive. https://t.co/XvckPOOguD
I shared our findings with the Small Business Committee and will fight for these changes as Congress considers the next coronavirus relief package. https://t.co/GNxM8gLg2H

The pandemic has taken a serious toll on our small business community in North Jersey. Over 350 small business owners from 52 towns in #NJ11 responded to our second survey and shared their experiences during COVID-19 and the challenges to reopening.
Essex County Residents: There will be a #COVID19 mobile testing site at the South Mountain Recreation Complex in West Orange on Thursday July 30 from 4-6pm. Details below ⬇️ https://t.co/GG2Gwurb6Y

Reminder: Our second NJ-11 Small Business Survey about the challenges due to COVID-19 and in reopening is closing tomorrow. So far we have responses from every town in #NJ11.   Find the survey here: https://t.co/4ZNoOpC8xH

Thank you to @WOMayorParisi @timsullivan510 @Zufall_Health CEO Eva Turbiner and Essex County Health Officer Maya Lordo for joining #MondayWithMikie last night! We had a great discussion about how our community continues to address COVID-19 and resources available to residents. https://t.co/DY7pdqNnti

Americans have reported more than $89.5 million in losses from scams related to the pandemic. My COVID-19 SCAM Act would protect consumers by giving the FTC the authority to seek civil penalties against those carrying out COVID-19 call and texting scams. https://t.co/MF167gGdx9

Based on feedback from #NJ11 small businesses I worked to get specific important changes made to the PPP & EIDL programs.  I launched a 2nd survey to hear from our small business community on the challenges they face due to COVID-19 and in reopening. ⬇️ https://t.co/Jm9y2jyEnm
A huge thank you to Anikait Sota in Parsippany and Maurice Korish and Adam Hollander in Livingston – all students who have taken their STEM backgrounds to help others during #COVID_19.

Join me on 7/13 for a #MondayWithMikie virtual meeting with Randolph Township to ask questions about COVID-19 the latest on reopening and to talk about the continued federal response.  Register Here ➡️ https://t.co/WGX4OpmET5  Submit Questions Here ➡️ https://t.co/f3tltWoIfM https://t.co/SRX81MBxJL

We need to invest in our roads railways and bridges to jumpstart our economy and build the 21st century infrastructure that America deserves. We just passed the #MovingForwardAct that includes my amendments to:  ✅ Support Gateway ✅ Improve #Covid_19 safety on mass transit https://t.co/wtlVcMJNvn

I am constantly inspired by how our community has come together during COVID-19 to help each other. This week Frontier Polymers & the iStar Group both HQed in #NJ11 donated 30K face masks to emergency management officials in our 4 counties. As Americans continue to test positive for COVID-19 and lose their employer-based healthcare coverage as a result of unemployment this Administration has doubled down on stripping a vital lifeline from 23 million people.  https://t.co/jGp8IYH165

We’ve seen the benefits of expanded telehealth services during the COVID-19 pandemic. I introduced the bipartisan Protect Telehealth Access Act today with @repkevinhern to ensure Medicare beneficiaries do not lose access to these important services. https://t.co/dBbtIIDwYw
Passaic County residents: Free mobile #COVID_19 testing is available throughout the county. Please review details at https://t.co/IOw8zGkpSj. https://t.co/zhCnYIQWSB

COVID-19 scam calls have resulted in over $49 million in losses across the country. I'm leading the COVID-19 SCAM Act with @RepPeteKing and members of the Regional Recovery Task Force to give the FTC the power to protect consumers. ⬇️ https://t.co/U2BJ8yrYUC

Thank you to the student mentors at Kids to Kids for adjusting your programs to serve children with special needs during #COVID_19. K2K’s participation in my Autism Awareness Month roundtables has given me a great appreciation for the amazing work you do!  https://t.co/Jq2EqvC5yX

Zufall Health Calvary Baptist Church & Empower the Village partnered today to bring free mobile #COVID_19 testing to Morristown. Thanks @RepMikeQuigley!  This #Pride I'm grateful for groups in #NJ11 like EDGE NJ especially for their dedication to continued access for our LGBTQ+ teens to support groups & tele-health services during COVID-19.  I'm nominating @teammoulton next for the #HousePrideChallenge! https://t.co/8FYwoaaLo5 https://t.co/agijHSNFL4

I’ve been monitoring #Covid_19 cases at VA facilities in NJ and along with the delegation have called for better care PPE and support for months. I stand with @SenBooker — after all the sacrifices our vets have made they must be taken care of at home. https://t.co/zClqj1Lf7P
Our medical professionals are working tirelessly at @HMHNewJersey to care for #COVID_19 patients. Here's how they are using convalescent plasma therapy to help save lives:  https://t.co/9K0e1O611E

Thank you @andresayegh for supporting the #SMARTFund. Local governments are bearing a significant burden as they respond to COVID—The bipartisan SMART Fund ensures they have the resources needed to keep residents safe & prevents cuts to essential services. https://t.co/eIX5hcovXe

Research on COVID-19 seasonality will help us predict patterns of transmission as the seasons change.  @RepJoeNeguse @USRepKCastor & I led colleagues urging the Office of Science & Technology Policy to direct all federal science agencies to collaborate on seasonality research ⤵️ https://t.co/9VHJkLNmVS

The National Guardsmen & women in NJ have been on the front lines of our fight against COVID-19. I joined @RepJimmyPanetta & @RepPeteKing to introduce the National Guard COVID-19 Earned Benefits Guarantee Act to ensure that these heroes have access to the benefits they’ve earned. https://t.co/xVms1qnwx2

That the administration would even consider ending National Guard COVID-19 deployments one day before they would receive benefits is deeply shameful. These men and women put their lives on the line to help us respond to the pandemic and deserve the benefits they've earned. https://t.co/5mMhL2DoJM
State and local governments in New Jersey are a critical line of defense in the effort to respond to #COVID_19. The federal government has a responsibility to help.

To date 10000 New Jerseyans have lost their lives to coronavirus.  1.1 million their jobs.  The toll of the pandemic on New Jersey cannot be understated. Nor can the need for additional relief. https://t.co/NPRdRjpp1o

States that have acted quickly to protect residents from the spread of #COVID19 should be held up as an example.  @RepPeteKing and I led a bipartisan request to Secretary Mnuchin to mend Treasury guidance which unfairly limits states’ ability to respond effectively to COVID-19. https://t.co/ucilIORhpp
I will be joining the Roseland virtual town hall tonight at 5pm to discuss the federal response to #COVID19. Details on how to join are here ⬇️ https://t.co/uuCQA20FRC

The NJ Attorney General’s series of virtual town halls on #COVID19 services begins today at 12:00pm with a focus on domestic violence and sexual assault. https://t.co/Pk03BeffJM

As we combat the #COVID19 pandemic we must consider the coming challenge of how we make sure we can get Americans back to work safely & how we prevent another significant outbreak. I’m thankful to report that I tested negative for #COVID19 today. I think my husband is starting to get to the other side of this and my family and I continue to pray for all the New Jerseyans and Americans who are dealing with this very real threat every day.

Join me my colleague @RepJoshG and PFANJ President Don Marino for a webinar at 4:30pm today. We'll be discussing #COVID19 response and taking questions. https://t.co/srWF9qLQ65

I had some good news from the Director: He told me they are focused on how to turn key medical equipment over to the states as quickly as possible. This is vital for New Jersey — we have the second highest number of COVID-19 cases in the country. 3/

New Jersey has the second highest rate of #COVID19 cases in the U.S. and our supply of personal protective equipment is rapidly decreasing. I joined with @SenatorMenendez today and the entire NJ delegation to call on HHS Secretary Azar to utilize the #DefenseProductionAct. https://t.co/15DdwoAPL7

With the #COVID19 outbreak community health centers like @Zufall_Health are going to be providing services well above and beyond what we normally ask them to do. I joined @RepMalinowski today to announce an additional $118K in funding for Zufall from the first COVID-19 package.

Our healthcare providers & first responders are our first and best line of defense against the spread of #COVID19. I joined a bipartisan group of 7 Democrats & 7 Republicans to introduce a resolution calling for aggressive use of the #DefenseProductionAct: https://t.co/4XTzccrl9k

☎️ Join me for our #COVID19 telephone town hall TONIGHT   📲 Dial (855)-731-4613 at 8:15pm  I'll be joined by medical providers and public officials and I'll give an update on what Congress is doing to address coronavirus in New Jersey. https://t.co/02Pa9xzKqJ

1. Receive updated information: The State Department provides updated travel advisories and information related to #COVID19 pandemic. Visit https://t.co/9KlPq42D6W for country specific information.

We must make sure our medical providers have the equipment necessary to administer #COVID19 tests. We need to protect small businesses and employees so they can make it through this tough time. We need personal protective equipment respirators ventilators & more hospital beds.

This bipartisan bill is a tremendous step in the right direction – it provides paid sick leave and paid family leave strengthens unemployment benefits makes #COVID19 testing free for all and provides food and medical aid to those in need.   But so much more needs to be done. https://t.co/7DhujFDk5m
The @DeptVetAffairs now has a dedicated page with resources for veterans about #COVID19 on symptoms how to access care and other important information: https://t.co/p6mfGLuZw4

In order to protect the public health and prevent the potential spread of #COVID19 my Parsippany & Washington offices will begin serving #NJ11 residents remotely and physical locations will be temporarily closed to visitors. My team is ready to help you via phone and email.

✅ Passed  The #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act will give families flexibility to stay home from work when they are sick and food security for their children. Crucially it will also make the coronavirus test free for everyone who needs one. https://t.co/XBCq7LpD8A
